verbose_text: Interestingly, Somlyo et al. [XREF_BIBR] indicated that MYPT1 was phosphorylated in PCa PC3 cells and endothelial cells (HUVECs), and phosphorylation of MYPT1 was reduced by the ROK inhibitor Wf-536, leading to the inhibition of vasculation by endothelial cells and lumen formation, as well as the earliest detectable stages of angiogenesis.
evidence: phosphorylation of MYPT1 was reduced by the ROK inhibitor
